channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple gets ready for AI in the enterprise with new ChatGPT configuration options
item.description: Apple will let businesses configure ChatGPT enterprise access in the fall.

item.title: The Best Big Screen Chromebook Is on Sale Now
item.description: A discount on the Asus CX15 Chromebook brings the price down to just $159.

item.title: Bluesky Goes Dark in Mississippi Over Age Verification Law
item.description: Bluesky has chosen to block access in the state rather than risk potential fines of up to $10,000 per violation.

item.title: The Best Google Pixel Phones of 2025, Tested and Reviewed: Which Model to Buy, Cases and Accessories, Feature Drops
item.description: Here’s a guide to all the models—plus Pixel case recommendations and smart software tricks to try.

item.title: Meta partners with Midjourney on AI image and video models
item.description: Meta's chief AI officer said that the company is partnering with Midjourney to license its AI image and video model technology.

item.title: US government plans to take a 10% stake in Intel
item.description: Such federal government ownership of a major corporation would mark a dramatic departure from long-standing U.S. policy.

item.title: Join Our Next Livestream: Back to School in the Age of AI
item.description: Bring your stories and questions on August 28 as we explore our latest investigations into how tech is shaping education today.

item.title: Bluesky blocks service in Mississippi over age assurance law
item.description: In a blog post published on Friday, the company explains that, as a small team, it doesn't have the resources to make the substantial technical change...

item.title: Coinbase CEO explains why he fired engineers who didn’t try AI immediately
item.description: After getting licenses to cover every engineer, some at the cryptocurrency exchange warned Armstrong that adoption would be slow, predicting it would ...

item.title: The Trump-Intel Deal Is Official
item.description: The $8.9 billion investment gives the US government a roughly 10 percent equity stake in Intel.
